page.title: 12SHANKLIN OLD VILLAGE
page.content: The original Shanklin Village started at what is now Shanklin cinema or theatre.It was a rather large farm then.In 1830 the only buildings in the village were an old church,the Manor House,the Vestry,the Crab Inn and Peaches Farm.The first and oldest building to be built around that area was Fishermans Cottage which was built by a Mr Colenutt in 1817.He was the man who opened Shanklin Chine which is a path that leads down to the sea.Shanklin Chine is right by the Old Village.Hotels were built by Victorian tourists e.g Daish's and Holliers.Cottages were built for the poorer people.A railway was built and it went straight through Shanklin.This made Shanklin more popular and it spread into a holiday resort.Shanklin never spreads southwards but always spreads towards the north.
